hanzi-su-wiki:
桟

Значения

Крестовина, поперечник, каркас; висячий мост

Мнемоника

Сокращение. Часть деревянной 木 конструкции, куда при изготовлении наносится много ударов 戔, крестовина.

Варианты

棧, 栈
purpleculture_pinyin:
zhàn
Japanese variant of 栈
Японский вариант 栈
rtega_mnemonic:
桟桟RScrosspiece, cleat, frame, door bolt, shelf
  • thing in wood 木 like two spears 㦮 together: door bolt or crosspiece or shelf
heisig_story: Prior to the use of metal, trees were once cut down and bound together for use as scaffolding material. In the case of this kanji, what is being constructed is not a skyscraper but a simple float.
myStory:
㦮 – see 戔 (“the appearance of being small; the appearance of accumulation”).

дерево + много накоплено
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: строительные леса, шип, рамка, дамба, болт (дверь)
koohiiStory1: Japanese festival floats are often so tall they need wood scaffolds to be completed. (http://www.japan-guide.com/e/e5909.html).
koohiiStory2: You need a SCAFFOLD made of WOOD to build a FLOAT if it will be several stories high.
jp_example_words: 桟橋(さんきょう): wharf, bridge, jetty, pier
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Carve a tree into a bar and lay it sticking out into the water to make a jetty or a pier. Now you can walk out on the jetty and go further into the water without needing a boat or getting wet.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine laying your tree turned bar into the water to make your own jetty. Innovative!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You made this jetty so it would be easier for Santa-san (さん) to dock his sleigh. Oh, you didn't know? His sleigh is more of a speed boat now, so he needs a jetty to give you presents, not a chimney anymore.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture Santa-san coming in from the water on his speedboat and docking on your jetty to deliver presents to you.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: a tree (木) or three spears (㦮) could be a scaffold

Name meaning
Nothing.
zhàn
яп. вм. 栈
Radicals: 木  (tree, bar)
Meaning Mnemonic
Carve a tree into a bar and lay it sticking out into the water to make a jetty or a pier. Now you can walk out on the jetty and go further into the water without needing a boat or getting wet.
Imagine laying your tree turned bar into the water to make your own jetty. Innovative!
Reading Mnemonic
You made this jetty so it would be easier for Santa-san (さん) to dock his sleigh. Oh, you didn't know? His sleigh is more of a speed boat now, so he needs a jetty to give you presents, not a chimney anymore.
Picture Santa-san coming in from the water on his speedboat and docking on your jetty to deliver presents to you.
